H0.text: Cause disease in living organisms is why decaying plants and animals are important to an ecosystem.

H1.text: Reducing soil erosion is a reason why decaying plants and animals are important to an ecosystem.

H2.text: Recycling oxygen to the air is what decaying plants and animals do, making them important to an ecosystem.

H3.text: Return nutrients to the soil is why decaying plants and animals are important to an ecosystem.

A4.text: The CDI surrounding the carcass will display an increase in soil carbon and nutrients such as phosphorus, potassium, calcium and magnesium; changes in pH; and a significant increase in soil nitrogen.

A5.text: Decomposition is a part of the nutrient cycle and is essential for recycling the finite matter that occupies physical space in the biosphere.
